verbose.description: Print lots more stuff (repeat for more). -v for INFO, -vv for DEBUG. Short: -v

quiet.description: Print as little stuff as possible. Short: -q

cache_dir.description: Directory rclone will use for caching

temp_dir.description: Directory rclone will use for temporary files

modify_window.description: Max time diff to be considered the same

checkers.description: Number of checkers to run in parallel

transfers.description: Number of file transfers to run in parallel

checksum.description: Check for changes with size & checksum (if available, or fallback to size only). Short: -c

size_only.description: Skip based on size only, not modtime or checksum

ignore_times.description: Don't skip items that match size and time - transfer all unconditionally. Short: -I

ignore_existing.description: Skip all files that exist on destination

ignore_errors.description: Delete even if there are I/O errors

dry_run.description: Do a trial run with no permanent changes. Short: -n

links.description: Translate symlinks to/from regular files with a '.rclonelink' extension. Short: -l

expect_continue_timeout.description: Timeout when using expect / 100-continue in HTTP

no_check_certificate.description: Do not verify the server SSL certificate (insecure)

ask_password.description: Allow prompt for password for encrypted configuration

password_command.description: Command for supplying password for encrypted configuration

max_delete.description: When synchronizing, limit the number of deletes (-1 for unlimited)

max_delete_size.description: When synchronizing, limit the total size of deletes

track_renames.description: When synchronizing, track file renames and do a server-side move if possible

track_renames_strategy.description: Strategies to use when synchronizing using track-renames

retries.description: Retry operations this many times if they fail

retries_sleep.description: Interval between retrying operations if they fail (0 to disable)

low_level_retries.description: Number of low level retries to do

update.description: Skip files that are newer on the destination. Short: -u

use_server_modtime.description: Use server modified time instead of object metadata

max_depth.description: If set limits the recursion depth to this (-1 for unlimited)

ignore_size.description: Ignore size when skipping use modtime or checksum

ignore_checksum.description: Skip post copy check of checksums

fix_case.description: Force rename of case insensitive dest to match source

no_traverse.description: Don't traverse destination file system on copy

check_first.description: Do all the checks before starting transfers

no_check_dest.description: Don't check the destination, copy regardless

no_unicode_normalization.description: Don't normalize unicode characters in filenames

no_update_modtime.description: Don't update destination modtime if files identical

compare_dest.description: Include additional server-side paths during comparison

copy_dest.description: Implies --compare-dest but also copies files from paths into destination

backup_dir.description: Make backups into hierarchy based in DIR

suffix.description: Suffix to add to changed files

fast_list.description: Use recursive list if available; uses more memory but fewer transactions

list_cutoff.description: To save memory, sort directory listings on disk above this threshold

tpslimit.description: Limit HTTP transactions per second to this (0 for unlimited)

user_agent.description: Set the user-agent to a specified string

immutable.description: Do not modify files, fail if existing files have been modified

auto_confirm.description: If enabled, do not request console confirmation

stats_unit.description: Show data rate in stats as either 'bits' or 'bytes' per second

stats_file_name_length.description: Max file name length in stats (0 for no limit)

bwlimit.description: Bandwidth limit in KiB/s, or use suffix B|K|M|G|T|P or a full timetable

bwlimit_file.description: Bandwidth limit per file in KiB/s, or use suffix B|K|M|G|T|P or a full timetable

buffer_size.description: In memory buffer size when reading files for each --transfer

streaming_upload_cutoff.description: Cutoff for switching to chunked upload if file size is unknown

dump.description: List of items to dump for debugging

dump_headers.description: Dump HTTP headers - may contain sensitive info (deprecated, use --dump headers)

dump_bodies.description: Dump HTTP headers and bodies - may contain sensitive info (deprecated, use --dump bodies)

max_transfer.description: Maximum size of data to transfer (-1 for unlimited)

max_duration.description: Maximum duration rclone will transfer data for

cutoff_mode.description: Mode to stop transfers when reaching the max transfer limit

max_backlog.description: Maximum number of objects in sync or check backlog

max_stats_groups.description: Maximum number of stats groups to keep in memory

stats_one_line.description: Make the stats fit on one line

stats_one_line_date.description: Enable --stats-one-line and add current date/time prefix

stats_one_line_date_format.description: Enable --stats-one-line-date and use custom formatted date

error_on_no_transfer.description: Sets exit code 9 if no files are transferred, useful in scripts

progress_terminal_title.description: Show progress on the terminal title (requires -P/--progress)

max_buffer_memory.description: If set, don't allocate more than this amount of memory as buffers

ca_cert.description: CA certificate used to verify servers

client_cert.description: Client SSL certificate (PEM) for mutual TLS auth

client_key.description: Client SSL private key (PEM) for mutual TLS auth

client_pass.description: Password for client SSL private key (PEM) for mutual TLS auth (obscured)

multi_thread_cutoff.description: Use multi-thread downloads for files above this size

multi_thread_streams.description: Number of streams to use for multi-thread downloads

multi_thread_write_buffer_size.description: In memory buffer size for writing when in multi-thread mode

multi_thread_chunk_size.description: Chunk size for multi-thread downloads / uploads, if not set by filesystem

order_by.description: Instructions on how to order the transfers

refresh_times.description: Refresh the modtime of remote files

no_console.description: Hide console window (supported on Windows only)

fs_cache_expire_duration.description: Cache remotes for this long (0 to disable caching)

fs_cache_expire_interval.description: Interval to check for expired remotes

disable_http2.description: Disable HTTP/2 in the global transport

human_readable.description: Print numbers in a human-readable format, sizes with suffix Ki|Mi|Gi|Ti|Pi

kv_lock_time.description: Maximum time to keep key-value database locked by process

disable_http_keep_alives.description: Disable HTTP keep-alives and use each connection once

metadata.description: If set, preserve metadata when copying objects. Short: -M

server_side_across_configs.description: Allow server-side operations (e.g. copy) to work across different configs

color.description: When to show colors (and other ANSI codes)

default_time.description: Time to show if modtime is unknown for files and directories

inplace.description: Download directly to destination file instead of atomic download to temp/rename

metadata_mapper.description: Program to run to transforming metadata before upload

partial_suffix.description: Add partial-suffix to temporary file name when --inplace is not used

max_connections.description: Maximum number of simultaneous backend API connections, 0 for unlimited

name_transform.description: Transform paths during the copy process

delete_before.description: When synchronizing, delete files on destination before transferring

delete_during.description: When synchronizing, delete files during transfer

delete_after.description: When synchronizing, delete files on destination after transferring (default)

bind.description: Local address to bind to for outgoing connections, IPv4, IPv6 or name

disable.description: Disable a comma separated list of features

header_upload.description: Set HTTP header for upload transactions

header_download.description: Set HTTP header for download transactions

header.description: Set HTTP header for all transactions

dscp.description: Set DSCP value to connections, value or name
